reviews.text: As others have noted, this hotel has been recently renovated. Everything is new, fresh, cheerful, and clean. It's conveniently located near the intersection of Loop 101 and Shea. We were there for medical appointments (the Mayo-Shea campus is only 6 miles from TownePlace) and appreciated being near 101 and the ease it provides to get around Scottsdale/east Phoenix.
reviews.title: Welcoming and Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff couldn't have been more welcoming and accommodating. The maid service was spot-on and unlike other reviewers, we found the breakfast area to be clean, organized and fully-stocked. We didn't use the pool even though we planned to do so. It was just so small and uninviting without any landscaping.
reviews.title: Nice room, lousy breakfast

reviews.text: We stayed in a studio suite with an open floor plan and 1 queen bed. It was small but workable for 2 people. The kitchen was nice to have, although if you want to actually prepare food in the room you should bring additional pots, pans, and cookware. It was sparsely stocked with only one or two pots, a colander, a large measuring cup, coffee mugs, small tumblers, and basic serving ware. It's adequately stocked for reheating food in the microwave, preparing sandwiches, etc.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Friendly, and Newly Renovated

reviews.text: We didn't experience any noise problems. Perhaps we didn't have any neighbors or our room was better insulated. It was quiet and very pleasant.
reviews.title: Renovation!
They are trying to make it better!
